Course Schedule

HPM 883 Spring 2026

Semester Overview

Dates: January 7 - April 27, 2026 Meeting Times: Mon/Wed 11:15am - 12:30pm (75 minutes) Format: Hybrid — In-person (lecture/discussion) and Remote (Zoom for labs)

Important Dates

Date Event
Jan 19 MLK Day (No Class)
Feb 9 Well-Being Day (No Class)
Mar 13-22 Spring Break
Apr 2 Well-Being Day (No Class)
Apr 28 Reading Day
May 1 Final Deliverable Due

Weekly Schedule

Week 1: Foundations (Jan 7-14)

Session Date Topic Format
1 Wed Jan 7 Course Overview & Causal Inference Foundations In-Person
2 Mon Jan 12 Reproducible Research Setup Remote
3 Wed Jan 14 Potential Outcomes & Structural Causal Models In-Person

Lab 0 assigned: Reproducible Research Setup (due Jan 19)

Week 2: Experimental Design I (Jan 19-21)

Session Date Topic Format
4 Mon Jan 19 NO CLASS — MLK Day —
5 Wed Jan 21 Randomization & Design-Based Inference In-Person

Due: Lab 0

Week 3: Experimental Design II (Jan 26-28)

Session Date Topic Format
6 Mon Jan 26 Experimental Design with DeclareDesign Remote
7 Wed Jan 28 Variance Reduction & Regression Adjustment In-Person

Lab 1 assigned: Experimental Design with DeclareDesign (due Feb 2)

Week 4: Influence Functions & Guest Lecture (Feb 2-4)

Instructor out of town

Session Date Topic Format
8 Mon Feb 2 Influence Functions Self-Study Async
9 Wed Feb 4 Guest Lecture: Tara Templin (Stanford) Remote

Due: Lab 1 Design Memo 1 assigned (due Feb 16)

Week 5: Neyman Orthogonality (Feb 9-11)

Session Date Topic Format
10 Mon Feb 9 NO CLASS — Well-Being Day —
11 Wed Feb 11 Neyman Orthogonality & Cross-Fitting In-Person

Week 6: Double ML & Doubly-Robust Estimators (Feb 16-18)

Session Date Topic Format
12 Mon Feb 16 Double/Debiased Machine Learning Remote
13 Wed Feb 18 Doubly-Robust Estimation (AIPW, TMLE) In-Person

Due: Design Memo 1 Lab 2 assigned: Double ML and DR Estimators (due Feb 23)

Week 7: Causal Forests & Meta-Learners (Feb 23-25)

Session Date Topic Format
14 Mon Feb 23 Causal Random Forests In-Person
15 Wed Feb 25 Causal Forests Implementation Remote

Due: Lab 2 Design Memo 2 assigned (due Mar 9) Lab 3 assigned: Causal Forests and Meta-Learners (due Mar 11)

Week 8: CATE Calibration & Meta-Learners (Mar 2-4)

Session Date Topic Format
16 Mon Mar 2 Meta-Learners for HTE In-Person
17 Wed Mar 4 CATE Calibration & Meta-Learners Lab Remote

Due: Design Memo 2 (Mar 9)

Week 9: Policy Learning (Mar 9-11)

Session Date Topic Format
18 Mon Mar 9 From CATE to Treatment Policy In-Person
19 Wed Mar 11 Policy Learning & Off-Policy Evaluation Lab Remote

Due: Lab 3 Lab 4 assigned: Policy Learning and OPE (due Mar 25)

Spring Break: March 13-22

No Classes

Week 10: Observational Causal ML (Mar 23-25)

Session Date Topic Format
20 Mon Mar 23 Causal Inference in Observational Studies In-Person
21 Wed Mar 25 Observational Causal ML Lab Remote

Due: Lab 4 Lab 5 assigned: Observational Causal ML (optional, due Apr 8)

Week 11: DiD and Synthetic Controls (Mar 30 - Apr 1)

Session Date Topic Format
22 Mon Mar 30 Modern Difference-in-Differences In-Person
23 Wed Apr 1 DiD and Synthetic Control Lab Remote

Lab 6 assigned: DiD and Synthetic Control (optional, due Apr 15)

Note: April 2 is Well-Being Day (Thursday) — No impact on M/W schedule

Week 12: Advanced Topics (Apr 6-8)

Session Date Topic Format
24 Mon Apr 6 Advanced Topics Survey In-Person
25 Wed Apr 8 Advanced Topics Application Lab Remote

Due: Lab 5 (optional) Capstone Proposal assigned (due Apr 13) Lab 7 assigned: Advanced Topic Exploration (optional, due Apr 20)

Week 13: Capstone Presentations I (Apr 13-15)

Session Date Topic Format
26 Mon Apr 13 Capstone Presentations (Round 1) In-Person
27 Wed Apr 15 Capstone Presentations (Round 2) In-Person

Due: Capstone Proposal Peer Review Report assigned (due Apr 22) Due: Lab 6 (optional)

Week 14: Capstone Presentations II & Synthesis (Apr 20-22)

Session Date Topic Format
28 Mon Apr 20 Final Capstone Presentations In-Person
29 Wed Apr 22 Course Wrap-Up & Future Directions In-Person

Due: Lab 7 (optional), Peer Review Report

Finals Week

Date Event
Tue Apr 28 Reading Day
Fri May 1 Capstone Project Package Due

Deliverables Summary

Required (95%)

Deliverable Due Date Weight
Lab 0: Reproducible Research Setup Jan 19 5%
Lab 1: Experimental Design Feb 2 5%
Design Memo 1: Experimental Design Plan Feb 16 10%
Lab 2: Double ML and DR Estimators Feb 23 5%
Design Memo 2: DML Analysis Plan Mar 9 10%
Lab 3: Causal Forests and Meta-Learners Mar 11 5%
Lab 4: Policy Learning and OPE Mar 25 5%
Capstone Proposal Apr 13 (part of capstone)
Peer Review Report Apr 22 5%
Capstone Project Package May 1 45%

Optional Extra Credit (up to 15%)

Deliverable Due Date
Lab 5: Observational Causal ML Apr 8
Lab 6: DiD and Synthetic Control Apr 15
Lab 7: Advanced Topics Apr 20

Format Key

Symbol Meaning
In-Person Lecture, discussion, collaborative work in Rosenau 228
Remote Zoom session for coding labs and implementation
Async Self-paced study, no live class
— No class (holiday or break)

Schedule subject to adjustment. Check announcements for any changes.
